title: How amateur negotiators have pulled the Brexit rug from under Boris Johnson
text:
Irrespective of whether Boris Johnson pulls off a last-minute deal with the EU over the next couple of days and rams it through a mutinous House of Commons, one thing is clear: Britain’s Brexit negotiations have been an unmitigated disaster from day one more than three years ago.

Indeed, if we have a few more deadline extensions, our attempt to get out of the EU – which I favour – will wind up lasting longer than the Great War.
